cats.name: Lion
cats.description: The lion typically inhabits grasslands and savannahs, but is absent in dense forest.

cats.name: Cheetah
cats.description: Cheetahs are active mainly during the day, with hunting their major activity. Adult males are sociable despite their territoriality, forming groups called coalitions.

cats.name: Puma
cats.description: Pumas are large, secretive cats. They are also commonly known as cougars and mountain lions, and are able to reach larger sizes than some other big cat individuals.

cats.name: Jaguar
cats.description: The jaguar is the largest cat species in the Americas and the third-largest after the tiger and the lion. This spotted cat closely resembles the leopard, but is usually larger and sturdier.

cats.name: Leopard
cats.description: The Leopard is a member of the genus Leopardus and is classified under the family Felidae.

cats.name: Tiger
cats.description: The Tiger is a member of the genus Leopardus and is classified under the family Felidae.
